form.official-title: To prohibit trespassing on critical infrastructure used in or affecting interstate commerce to commit a criminal offense.

section.header: Trespassing on critical infrastructure used in or affecting interstate commerce to commit crime

subsection.text: Chapter 65 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

section.header: Trespassing on critical infrastructure used in or affecting interstate commerce to commit crime

subsection.text: In this section, the term critical infrastructure—

paragraph.text: means physical systems and assets so vital to the United States that the incapacity or destruction of such systems and assets would have a debilitating impact on security, national economic security, national public health or safety, or any combination of those matters; and
includes a landmark, structure, or other object—

subparagraph.text: declared to be a national monument under section 2 of the Act of June 8, 1906 (commonly known as the Antiquities Act of 1906) (16 U.S.C. 431); or
established as a national monument by an Act of Congress.

subsection.text: It shall be unlawful to knowingly go on any critical infrastructure used in or affecting interstate commerce, with intent to commit a criminal offense.
Any person who violates subsection (b) shall be fined under this title, imprisoned for not more than 5 years, or both.
The table of sections for chapter 65 of title 18, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

toc.toc-entry: 1370. Trespassing on critical infrastructure used in or affecting interstate commerce to commit crime.
